content:
SerializerDescriptor Class

In this Article

Provides information about installed plug-in serializers.

Syntax

Declaration

public sealed class SerializerDescriptor

Inheritance Hierarchy

  • System.Object
  • SerializerDescriptor

Inherited Members

Equals(Object,Object)
,
GetType()
,
MemberwiseClone()
,
ReferenceEquals(Object,Object)
,
ToString()

Remarks

Plug-in serializer classes derive from and implement the ISerializerFactory interface.

Properties summary

AssemblyName

Gets the name of the assembly that contains the serializer.
AssemblyPath

Gets the path to the assembly file that contains the serializer.
AssemblyVersion

Gets the version of the assembly that contains the serializer.
DefaultFileExtension

Gets the default extension associated with files that the serializer outputs.
DisplayName

Gets the public display name of the serializer.
FactoryInterfaceName

Gets the name of the ISerializerFactory derived class that implements the serializer.
IsLoadable

Gets a value indicating whether the serializer can be loaded with the currently installed version of Microsoft .NET Framework.
ManufacturerName

Gets the name of the company that developed the serializer.
ManufacturerWebsite

Gets the web address of the company that developed the serializer.
WinFXVersion

Gets the version of Microsoft .NET Framework required by the serializer.

Methods summary

CreateFromFactoryInstance(ISerializerFactory)

Creates a new SerializerDescriptor through a given ISerializerFactory implementation.
Equals(Object)

Tests two SerializerDescriptor objects for equality.
GetHashCode()

Gets the unique hash code value of the serializer.

Properties

  • AssemblyName

    Gets the name of the assembly that contains the serializer.

    public string AssemblyName { get; }

    Property Value

    • String

      The name of the assembly (usually a DLL) that contains the plug-in serializer.

  • AssemblyPath

    Gets the path to the assembly file that contains the serializer.

    public string AssemblyPath { get; }

    Property Value

    • String

      The path to the assembly file that contains the plug-in serializer.

  • AssemblyVersion

    Gets the version of the assembly that contains the serializer.

    public Version AssemblyVersion { get; }

    Property Value

    • Version

      The version of the assembly that contains the plug-in serializer.

  • DefaultFileExtension

    Gets the default extension associated with files that the serializer outputs.

    public string DefaultFileExtension { get; }

    Property Value

    • String

      The default extension associated with files that the serializer outputs.

    Example

    The following examples illustrate using DefaultFileExtension to return the default file extensions for installed plug-in serializers. 

    // Create a SerializerProvider for accessing plug-in serializers.
SerializerProvider serializerProvider = new SerializerProvider();

// Locate the serializer that matches the fileName extension.
SerializerDescriptor selectedPlugIn = null;
foreach ( SerializerDescriptor serializerDescriptor in
                serializerProvider.InstalledSerializers )
{
    if ( serializerDescriptor.IsLoadable &&
         fileName.EndsWith(serializerDescriptor.DefaultFileExtension) )
    {   // The plug-in serializer and fileName extensions match.
        selectedPlugIn = serializerDescriptor;
        break; // foreach
    }
}

// If a match for a plug-in serializer was found,
// use it to output and store the document.
if (selectedPlugIn != null)
{
    Stream package = File.Create(fileName);
    SerializerWriter serializerWriter =
        serializerProvider.CreateSerializerWriter(selectedPlugIn,
                                                  package);
    IDocumentPaginatorSource idoc =
        flowDocument as IDocumentPaginatorSource;
    serializerWriter.Write(idoc.DocumentPaginator, null);
    package.Close();
    return true;
}

    // ------------------------ PlugInFileFilter --------------------------
/// <summary>
///   Gets a filter string for installed plug-in serializers.</summary>
/// <remark>
///   PlugInFileFilter is used to set the SaveFileDialog or
///   OpenFileDialog "Filter" property when saving or opening files
///   using plug-in serializers.</remark>
private string PlugInFileFilter
{
    get
    {   // Create a SerializerProvider for accessing plug-in serializers.
        SerializerProvider serializerProvider = new SerializerProvider();
        string filter = "";

        // For each loadable serializer, add its display
        // name and extension to the filter string.
        foreach (SerializerDescriptor serializerDescriptor in
            serializerProvider.InstalledSerializers)
        {
            if (serializerDescriptor.IsLoadable)
            {
                // After the first, separate entries with a "|".
                if (filter.Length > 0)   filter += "|";

                // Add an entry with the plug-in name and extension.
                filter += serializerDescriptor.DisplayName + " (*" +
                    serializerDescriptor.DefaultFileExtension + ")|*" +
                    serializerDescriptor.DefaultFileExtension;
            }
        }

        // Return the filter string of installed plug-in serializers.
        return filter;
    }
}
  • DisplayName

    Gets the public display name of the serializer.

    public string DisplayName { get; }

    Property Value

    • String

      The public display name of the serializer.

    Example

    The following example shows using DisplayName to obtain and display the public name of a plug-in serializer. 

    // ------------------------ PlugInFileFilter --------------------------
/// <summary>
///   Gets a filter string for installed plug-in serializers.</summary>
/// <remark>
///   PlugInFileFilter is used to set the SaveFileDialog or
///   OpenFileDialog "Filter" property when saving or opening files
///   using plug-in serializers.</remark>
private string PlugInFileFilter
{
    get
    {   // Create a SerializerProvider for accessing plug-in serializers.
        SerializerProvider serializerProvider = new SerializerProvider();
        string filter = "";

        // For each loadable serializer, add its display
        // name and extension to the filter string.
        foreach (SerializerDescriptor serializerDescriptor in
            serializerProvider.InstalledSerializers)
        {
            if (serializerDescriptor.IsLoadable)
            {
                // After the first, separate entries with a "|".
                if (filter.Length > 0)   filter += "|";

                // Add an entry with the plug-in name and extension.
                filter += serializerDescriptor.DisplayName + " (*" +
                    serializerDescriptor.DefaultFileExtension + ")|*" +
                    serializerDescriptor.DefaultFileExtension;
            }
        }

        // Return the filter string of installed plug-in serializers.
        return filter;
    }
}
  • FactoryInterfaceName

    Gets the name of the ISerializerFactory derived class that implements the serializer.

    public string FactoryInterfaceName { get; }

    Property Value

    • String

      The name of the ISerializerFactory derived class that implements the serializer.

  • IsLoadable

    Gets a value indicating whether the serializer can be loaded with the currently installed version of Microsoft .NET Framework.

    public bool IsLoadable { get; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      true if the serializer assembly can be loaded; otherwise, false. The default is false.

    Remarks

    IsLoadable should be false unless AssemblyVersion has the same value as WinFXVersion.

    Example

    The following examples illustrate using IsLoadable to determine if the associated plug-in serializer can be loaded and used. 

    // ------------------------ PlugInFileFilter --------------------------
/// <summary>
///   Gets a filter string for installed plug-in serializers.</summary>
/// <remark>
///   PlugInFileFilter is used to set the SaveFileDialog or
///   OpenFileDialog "Filter" property when saving or opening files
///   using plug-in serializers.</remark>
private string PlugInFileFilter
{
    get
    {   // Create a SerializerProvider for accessing plug-in serializers.
        SerializerProvider serializerProvider = new SerializerProvider();
        string filter = "";

        // For each loadable serializer, add its display
        // name and extension to the filter string.
        foreach (SerializerDescriptor serializerDescriptor in
            serializerProvider.InstalledSerializers)
        {
            if (serializerDescriptor.IsLoadable)
            {
                // After the first, separate entries with a "|".
                if (filter.Length > 0)   filter += "|";

                // Add an entry with the plug-in name and extension.
                filter += serializerDescriptor.DisplayName + " (*" +
                    serializerDescriptor.DefaultFileExtension + ")|*" +
                    serializerDescriptor.DefaultFileExtension;
            }
        }

        // Return the filter string of installed plug-in serializers.
        return filter;
    }
}

    // Create a SerializerProvider for accessing plug-in serializers.
SerializerProvider serializerProvider = new SerializerProvider();

// Locate the serializer that matches the fileName extension.
SerializerDescriptor selectedPlugIn = null;
foreach ( SerializerDescriptor serializerDescriptor in
                serializerProvider.InstalledSerializers )
{
    if ( serializerDescriptor.IsLoadable &&
         fileName.EndsWith(serializerDescriptor.DefaultFileExtension) )
    {   // The plug-in serializer and fileName extensions match.
        selectedPlugIn = serializerDescriptor;
        break; // foreach
    }
}

// If a match for a plug-in serializer was found,
// use it to output and store the document.
if (selectedPlugIn != null)
{
    Stream package = File.Create(fileName);
    SerializerWriter serializerWriter =
        serializerProvider.CreateSerializerWriter(selectedPlugIn,
                                                  package);
    IDocumentPaginatorSource idoc =
        flowDocument as IDocumentPaginatorSource;
    serializerWriter.Write(idoc.DocumentPaginator, null);
    package.Close();
    return true;
}
  • ManufacturerName

    Gets the name of the company that developed the serializer.

    public string ManufacturerName { get; }

    Property Value

    • String

      The name of the company that developed the plug-in serializer.

    Remarks

    Plug-in serializer classes derive from and implement the ISerializerFactory interface.

  • ManufacturerWebsite

    Gets the web address of the company that developed the serializer.

    public Uri ManufacturerWebsite { get; }

    Property Value

    • Uri

      The web address of the company that developed the serializer.

  • WinFXVersion

    Gets the version of Microsoft .NET Framework required by the serializer.

    public Version WinFXVersion { get; }

    Property Value

    • Version

      The version of Microsoft .NET Framework required by the plug-in serializer.

    Remarks

    WinFXVersion must have the same value as the AssemblyVersion or the serializer assembly cannot be loaded.

Methods

  • CreateFromFactoryInstance(ISerializerFactory)

    Creates a new SerializerDescriptor through a given ISerializerFactory implementation.

    public static System.Windows.Documents.Serialization.SerializerDescriptor CreateFromFactoryInstance (System.Windows.Documents.Serialization.ISerializerFactory factoryInstance);

    Parameters

    • factoryInstance
      ISerializerFactory

      The source of data for the new SerializerDescriptor.

    Returns

    • SerializerDescriptor

      A new SerializerDescriptor with its properties initialized with values from the given ISerializerFactory implementation.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentNullException

      factoryInstance is null.

    • ArgumentException

      One or more of the following properties of the factoryInstance is null: stem.Windows.Documents.Serialization.SerializerDescriptor.DisplayName*, stem.Windows.Documents.Serialization.SerializerDescriptor.ManufacturerName*, stem.Windows.Documents.Serialization.SerializerDescriptor.ManufacturerWebsite*, and stem.Windows.Documents.Serialization.SerializerDescriptor.DefaultFileExtension*

    Remarks

    Only full trust callers can use this method.

  • Equals(Object)

    Tests two SerializerDescriptor objects for equality.

    public override bool Equals (object obj);

    Parameters

    • obj
      System.Object

      The object to be compared with this SerializerDescriptor.

    Returns

    • Boolean

      true if both are equal; otherwise, false.

    Remarks

    Equals returns true even if the two objects differ in one or more of the following properties: ManufacturerName, ManufacturerWebsite, and IsLoadable.

  • GetHashCode()

    Gets the unique hash code value of the serializer.

    public override int GetHashCode ();

    Returns

    • Int32

      The unique hash code value of the serializer.

    Remarks

    The unique hash code value is created based on the DisplayName, AssemblyName, AssemblyPath, AssemblyVersion, FactoryInterfaceName, and WinFXVersion properties of the serializer.
